channel.title: Transfer on Simba Tango
channel.description: Recent content in Transfer on Simba Tango

item.title: More Fast Transfers
item.author: simbatango@gmail.com (Simba)
item.description: by Aleera* I have previously discussed too fast transfers from 78s. Age Akkerman has a well researched take on Di Sarli’s El ciruja which he found to be about 5% too fast on the Euro Records transfer.

item.title: Too Fast Transfers
item.author: simbatango@gmail.com (Simba)
item.description: I sort of promised to post a few samples of my results from slowing down some tracks that I believe are transferred at too high speed in the DyM Tango Classics collection. Although I have suspected that several other transfers, most notably on the El Bandoneon label were transferred at too high speed, I never tried slowing them down myself because I knew it to be hard to find the correct speed.

item.title: DyM Online | Tango Classics
item.author: simbatango@gmail.com (Simba)
item.description: byÂ Todd Binger I decided to check out the offerings of DyM a bit more closely after I noticed that some of them were available in lossless format from the French site Qobuz. I got a couple of De Caro compilations because they are hard to get by other places. These tracks are mostly from the late 20s and early 30s, so what I found out may or may not apply to other, later recordings issued in this series.
